properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The group name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The group description.

properties.name: product
properties.description: • product - (Required) Operation system type. Valid values: "Linux/UNIX", "SUSE Linux", "Windows". For EC2 Classic instances: "Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC)", "SUSE Linux (Amazon VPC)", "Windows (Amazon VPC)".

properties.name: availability_zones
properties.description: • availability_zones - (Optional) List of Strings of availability zones. When this parameter is set, subnet_ids should be left unused. Note: availability_zones naming syntax follows the convention availability-zone:subnet:placement-group-name. For example, to set an AZ in us-east-1 with subnet subnet-123456 and placement group ClusterI03, you would set: availability_zones = ["us-east-1a:subnet-123456:ClusterI03"]

properties.name: subnet_ids
properties.description: • subnet_ids - (Optional) List of Strings of subnet identifiers. Note: When this parameter is set, availability_zones should be left unused.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The AWS region your group will be created in. Note: This parameter is required if you specify subnets (through subnet_ids). This parameter is optional if you specify Availability Zones (through availability_zones).

properties.name: preferred_availability_zones
properties.description: • preferred_availability_zones - The AZs to prioritize when launching Spot instances. If no markets are available in the Preferred AZs, Spot instances are launched in the non-preferred AZs. Note: Must be a sublist of availability_zones and orientation value must not be "equalAzDistribution".

properties.name: max_size
properties.description: • max_size - (Optional; Required if using scaling policies) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.

properties.name: min_size
properties.description: • min_size - (Optional; Required if using scaling policies) The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.

properties.name: desired_capacity
properties.description: • desired_capacity - (Optional) The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.

properties.name: capacity_unit
properties.description: • capacity_unit - (Optional, Default: "instance") The capacity unit to launch instances by. If not specified, when choosing the weight unit, each instance will weight as the number of its vCPUs.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: • security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: • image_id - (Optional) The ID of the AMI used to launch the instance.

properties.name: iam_instance_profile
properties.description: • iam_instance_profile - (Optional) The ARN or name of an IAM instance profile to associate with launched instances.

properties.name: key_name
properties.description: • key_name - (Optional) The key name that should be used for the instance.

properties.name: enable_monitoring
properties.description: • enable_monitoring - (Optional) Indicates whether monitoring is enabled for the instance.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.

properties.name: shutdown_script
properties.description: • shutdown_script - (Optional) The Base64-encoded shutdown script that executes prior to instance termination, for more information please see: Shutdown Script

properties.name: ebs_optimized
properties.description: • ebs_optimized - (Optional) Enable high bandwidth connectivity between instances and AWS’s Elastic Block Store (EBS). For instance types that are EBS-optimized by default this parameter will be ignored.

properties.name: placement_tenancy
properties.description: • placement_tenancy - (Optional) Enable dedicated tenancy. Note: There is a flat hourly fee for each region in which dedicated tenancy is used.

properties.name: instance_types_ondemand
properties.description: • instance_types_ondemand - (Required) The type of instance determines your instance's CPU capacity, memory and storage (e.g., m1.small, c1.xlarge).

properties.name: instance_types_spot
properties.description: • instance_types_spot - (Required) One or more instance types.

properties.name: instance_types_preferred_spot
properties.description: • instance_types_preferred_spot - (Optional) Prioritize a subset of spot instance types. Must be a subset of the selected spot instance types.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: instance_types_weights - (Optional) List of weights per instance type for weighted groups. Each object in the list should have the following attributes:

properties.name: weight
properties.description: (Required) Weight per instance type (Integer).

properties.name: instance_type
properties.description: (Required) Name of instance type (String).

properties.name: cpu_credits
properties.description: • cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: standard, unlimited.

properties.name: fallback_to_ondemand
properties.description: • fallback_to_ondemand - (Required) In a case of no Spot instances available, Elastigroup will launch on-demand instances instead.

properties.name: wait_for_capacity
properties.description: • wait_for_capacity - (Optional) Minimum number of instances in a 'HEALTHY' status that is required before continuing. This is ignored when updating with blue/green deployment. Cannot exceed desired_capacity.

properties.name: wait_for_capacity_timeout
properties.description: • wait_for_capacity_timeout - (Optional) Time (seconds) to wait for instances to report a 'HEALTHY' status. Useful for plans with multiple dependencies that take some time to initialize. Leave undefined or set to 0 to indicate no wait. This is ignored when updating with blue/green deployment.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: • orientation - (Required, Default: "balanced") Select a prediction strategy. Valid values: "balanced", "costOriented", "equalAzDistribution", "availabilityOriented".

properties.name: spot_percentage
properties.description: • spot_percentage - (Optional; Required if not using ondemand_count) The percentage of Spot instances that would spin up from the desired_capacity number.

properties.name: ondemand_count
properties.description: • ondemand_count - (Optional; Required if not using spot_percentage) Number of on demand instances to launch in the group. All other instances will be spot instances. When this parameter is set the spot_percentage parameter is being ignored.

properties.name: draining_timeout
properties.description: • draining_timeout - (Optional) The time in seconds, the instance is allowed to run while detached from the ELB. This is to allow the instance time to be drained from incoming TCP connections before terminating it, during a scale down operation.

properties.name: utilize_reserved_instances
properties.description: • utilize_reserved_instances - (Optional) In a case of any available reserved instances, Elastigroup will utilize them first before purchasing Spot instances.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: scaling_strategy - (Optional) Set termination policy.

properties.name: terminate_at_end_of_billing_hour
properties.description: (Optional) Specify whether to terminate instances at the end of each billing hour.

properties.name: termination_policy
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: health_check_type
properties.description: • health_check_type - (Optional) The service that will perform health checks for the instance. Valid values: "ELB", "HCS", "TARGET_GROUP", "MLB", "EC2", "MULTAI_TARGET_SET", "MLB_RUNTIME", "K8S_NODE", "NOMAD_NODE", "ECS_CLUSTER_INSTANCE".

properties.name: health_check_grace_period
properties.description: • health_check_grace_period - (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, after the instance has launched to starts and check its health.

properties.name: health_check_unhealthy_duration_before_replacement
properties.description: • health_check_unhealthy_duration_before_replacement - (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, that we will wait before replacing an instance that is running and became unhealthy (this is only applicable for instances that were once healthy).

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: elastic_ips
properties.description: • elastic_ips - (Optional) A list of AWS Elastic IP allocation IDs to associate to the group instances.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: revert_to_spot - (Optional) Hold settings for strategy correction – replacing On-Demand for Spot instances. Supported Values: "never", "always", "timeWindow"

properties.name: perform_at
properties.description: (Required) In the event of a fallback to On-Demand instances, select the time period to revert back to Spot. Supported Arguments – always (default), timeWindow, never. For timeWindow or never to be valid the group must have availabilityOriented OR persistence defined.

properties.name: time_windows
properties.description: (Optional) Specify a list of time windows for to execute revertToSpot strategy. Time window format: ddd:hh:mm-ddd:hh:mm. Example: Mon:03:00-Wed:02:30

properties.name: load-balancers
properties.description: » Load Balancers

properties.name: elastic_load_balancers
properties.description: (Optional) List of Elastic Load Balancers names (ELB).

properties.name: target_group_arns
properties.description: (Optional) List of Target Group ARNs to register the instances to.

properties.name: list description
target_set_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of Multai target set.

properties.name: balancer_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of Multai Load Balancer.
Usage:

elastic_load_balancers = ["bal5", "bal2"]
  target_group_arns      = ["tg-arn"]

  multai_target_sets {
    target_set_id = "ts-123",
    balancer_id   = "bal-123"
  }

  multai_target_sets {
    target_set_id = "ts-234",
    balancer_id   = "bal-234"
  }

properties.name: signals
properties.description: » Signals
Each signal supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the signal defined for the group. Valid Values: "INSTANCE_READY", "INSTANCE_READY_TO_SHUTDOWN"

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) The signals defined timeout- default is 40 minutes (1800 seconds).
Usage:

signal {
    name    = "INSTANCE_READY_TO_SHUTDOWN"
    timeout = 100
  }

properties.name: scheduled-tasks
properties.description: » Scheduled Tasks
Each scheduled_task supports the following:

properties.name: task_type
properties.description: (Required) The task type to run. Supported task types are: "scale", "backup_ami", "roll", "scaleUp", "percentageScaleUp", "scaleDown", "percentageScaleDown", "statefulUpdateCapacity".

properties.name: cron_expression
properties.description: (Optional; Required if not using frequency) A valid cron expression. The cron is running in UTC time zone and is in Unix cron format.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: (Optional; Format: ISO 8601) Set a start time for one time tasks.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: (Optional; Required if not using cron_expression) The recurrence frequency to run this task. Supported values are "hourly", "daily", "weekly" and "continuous".

properties.name: scale_target_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) The desired number of instances the group should have.

properties.name: scale_min_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum number of instances the group should have.

properties.name: scale_max_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum number of instances the group should have.

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: (Optional, Default: true) Setting the task to being enabled or disabled.

properties.name: target_capacity
properties.description: (Optional; Only valid for statefulUpdateCapacity) The desired number of instances the group should have.

properties.name: min_capacity
properties.description: (Optional; Only valid for statefulUpdateCapacity) The minimum number of instances the group should have.

properties.name: max_capacity
properties.description: (Optional; Only valid for statefulUpdateCapacity) The maximum number of instances the group should have.

properties.name: batch_size_percentage
properties.description: (Optional; Required when the task_type is "roll".) The percentage size of each batch in the scheduled deployment roll.

properties.name: grace_period
properties.description: (Optional) The period of time (seconds) to wait before checking a batch's health after it's deployment.

properties.name: adjustment
properties.description: (Optional; Min 1) The number of instances to add or remove.

properties.name: adjustment_percentage
properties.description: (Optional; Min 1) The percentage of instances to add or remove.
Usage:

scheduled_task {
    task_type             = "backup_ami"
    cron_expression       = ""
    start_time            = "1970-01-01T01:00:00Z"
    frequency             = "hourly"
    scale_target_capacity = 5
    scale_min_capacity    = 0
    scale_max_capacity    = 10
    is_enabled            = false
    target_capacity       = 5
    min_capacity          = 0
    max_capacity          = 10
    batch_size_percentage = 33
    grace_period          = 300
  }

properties.name: scaling-policies
properties.description: » Scaling Policies
Each scaling_*_policy supports the following:

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: (Required) The namespace for the alarm's associated metric.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the metric, with or without spaces.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Required) The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

properties.name: policy_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the policy.

properties.name: statistic
properties.description: (Optional, Default: "average") The metric statistics to return. For information about specific statistics go to Statistics in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: (Required) The unit for the alarm's associated metric. Valid values: "percent, "seconds", "microseconds", "milliseconds", "bytes", "kilobytes", "megabytes", "gigabytes", "terabytes", "bits", "kilobits", "megabits", "gigabits", "terabits", "count", "bytes/second", "kilobytes/second", "megabytes/second", "gigabytes/second", "terabytes/second", "bits/second", "kilobits/second", "megabits/second", "gigabits/second", "terabits/second", "count/second", "none".

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: (Optional, Default: true) Specifies whether the scaling policy described in this block is enabled.

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 300) The granularity, in seconds, of the returned datapoints. Period must be at least 60 seconds and must be a multiple of 60.

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 1) The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 300) The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling activity can start. If this parameter is not specified, the default cooldown period for the group applies.

properties.name: list description
name
properties.description: (Required) The dimension name.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The dimension value.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Optional, Scale Up Default: gte, Scale Down Default: lte) The operator to use in order to determine if the scaling policy is applicable. Valid values: "gt", "gte", "lt", "lte".

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Optional) The source of the metric. Valid values: "cloudWatch", "spectrum".

properties.name: action_type
properties.description: • action_type - (Optional; if not using min_target_capacity or max_target_capacity) The type of action to perform for scaling. Valid values: "adjustment", "percentageAdjustment", "setMaxTarget", "setMinTarget", "updateCapacity".
If you do not specify an action type, you can only use – adjustment, minTargetCapacity, maxTargetCapacity. While using action_type, please also set the following:

When using adjustment – set the field adjustment When using percentageAdjustment - set the field adjustment When using setMaxTarget – set the field max_target_capacity When using setMinTarget – set the field min_target_capacity When using updateCapacity – set the fields minimum, maximum, and target

properties.name: adjustment
properties.description: (Optional; if not using min_target_capacity or max_target_capacity;) The number of instances to add/remove to/from the target capacity when scale is needed. Can be used as advanced expression for scaling of instances to add/remove to/from the target capacity when scale is needed. You can see more information here: Advanced expression. Example value: "MAX(currCapacity / 5, value * 10)"

properties.name: min_target_capacity
properties.description: (Optional; if not using adjustment; available only for scale up). The number of the desired target (and minimum) capacity

properties.name: max_target_capacity
properties.description: • max_target_capacity - (Optional; if not using adjustment; available only for scale down). The number of the desired target (and maximum) capacity

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: • minimum - (Optional; if using updateCapacity) The minimal number of instances to have in the group.

properties.name: maximum
properties.description: • maximum - (Optional; if using updateCapacity) The maximal number of instances to have in the group.

properties.name: target
properties.description: • target - (Optional; if using updateCapacity) The target number of instances to have in the group.
scaling_target_policies support predictive scaling:

properties.name: predictive_mode
properties.description: (Optional) Start a metric prediction process to determine the expected target metric value within the next two days. See Predictive Autoscaling documentation for more info. Valid values: FORECAST_AND_SCALE, FORECAST_ONLY.
Usage:

scaling_up_policy {
    policy_name = "policy-name"
    metric_name = "CPUUtilization"
    namespace   = "AWS/EC2"
    source      = ""
    statistic   = "average"
    unit        = ""
    cooldown    = 60
    is_enabled  = false

    dimensions {
        name  = "name-1"
        value = "value-1"
    }

    threshold          = 10
    operator           = "gt"
    evaluation_periods = 10
    period             = 60

    // === MIN TARGET ===================
    action_type         = "setMinTarget"
    min_target_capacity = 1
    // ==================================

    // === ADJUSTMENT ===================
    # action_type = "adjustment"
    # action_type = "percentageAdjustment"
    # adjustment  = "MAX(5,10)"
    // ==================================

    // === UPDATE CAPACITY ==============
    # action_type = "updateCapacity"
    # minimum     = 0
    # maximum     = 10
    # target      = 5
    // ==================================

  }

scaling_target_policy {
      policy_name     = ""
      metric_name     = ""
      namespace       = ""
      source          = ""
      statistic       = ""
      unit            = ""
      cooldown        = 10
      target          = 1
      predictive_mode = ""

      dimensions {
        name  = ""
        value = ""
      }
  }

properties.name: network-interfaces
properties.description: » Network Interfaces

Each of the network_interface attributes controls a portion of the AWS Instance's "Elastic Network Interfaces". It's a good idea to familiarize yourself with AWS's Elastic Network Interfaces docs to understand the implications of using these attributes.

properties.name: network_interface_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the network interface.

properties.name: device_index
properties.description: (Required) The index of the device on the instance for the network interface attachment.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Required) The description of the network interface.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: (Optional) The private IP address of the network interface.

properties.name: delete_on_termination
properties.description: (Optional) If set to true, the interface is deleted when the instance is terminated.

properties.name: secondary_private_ip_address_count
properties.description: (Optional) The number of secondary private IP addresses.

properties.name: associate_public_ip_address
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether to assign a public IP address to an instance you launch in a VPC. The public IP address can only be assigned to a network interface for eth0, and can only be assigned to a new network interface, not an existing one.

properties.name: associate_ipv6_address
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates whether to assign IPV6 addresses to your instance. Requires a subnet with IPV6 CIDR block ranges.
Usage:

network_interface { 
    network_interface_id               = "" 
    device_index                       = 1
    description                        = "nic description in here"
    private_ip_address                 = "1.1.1.1"
    delete_on_termination              = false
    secondary_private_ip_address_count = 1
    associate_public_ip_address        = true
  }

properties.name: block-devices
properties.description: » Block Devices

Each of the *_block_device attributes controls a portion of the AWS Instance's "Block Device Mapping". It's a good idea to familiarize yourself with AWS's Block Device Mapping docs to understand the implications of using these attributes.
Each ebs_block_device supports the following:

properties.name: device_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the device to mount.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: (Optional) The Snapshot ID to mount.

properties.name: volume_type
properties.description: (Optional, Default: "standard") The type of volume. Can be "standard", "gp2", "io1", "st1" or "sc1".

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: (Optional) The size of the volume in gigabytes.

properties.name: iops
properties.description: (Optional) The amount of provisioned IOPS. This must be set with a volume_type of "io1".

properties.name: delete_on_termination
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the volume should be destroyed on instance termination.

properties.name: encrypted
properties.description: (Optional) Enables EBS encryption on the volume.

properties.name: kms_key_id
properties.description: (Optional) ID for a user managed CMK under which the EBS Volume is encrypted
Modifying any ebs_block_device currently requires resource replacement.
Usage:

ebs_block_device {
     device_name           = "/dev/sdb" 
     snapshot_id           = "" 
     volume_type           = "gp2"  
     volume_size           = 8
     iops                  = 1
     delete_on_termination = true
     encrypted             = false
     kms_key_id            = "kms-key-01"
   }

   ebs_block_device {
     device_name           = "/dev/sdc" 
     snapshot_id           = "" 
     volume_type           = "gp2"  
     volume_size           = 8  
     iops                  = 1
     delete_on_termination = true
     encrypted             = true
     kms_key_id            = "kms-key-02"
  }
Each ephemeral_block_device supports the following:

properties.name: device_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the block device to mount on the instance.

properties.name: virtual_name
properties.description: (Required) The Instance Store Device Name (e.g. "ephemeral0").
Usage:

ephemeral_block_device {
    device_name  = "/dev/xvdc"
    virtual_name = "ephemeral0"
  }

properties.name: stateful
properties.description: » Stateful
We support instance persistence via the following configurations. all values are boolean. For more information on instance persistence please see: Stateful configuration

properties.name: persist_root_device
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean, should the instance maintain its root device volumes.

properties.name: persist_block_devices
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean, should the instance maintain its Data volumes.

properties.name: persist_private_ip
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean, should the instance maintain its private IP.

properties.name: block_devices_mode
properties.description: (Optional) String, determine the way we attach the data volumes to the data devices, possible values: "reattach" and "onLaunch" (default is onLaunch).

properties.name: private_ips
properties.description: (Optional) List of Private IPs to associate to the group instances.(e.g. "172.1.1.0"). Please note: This setting will only apply if persistence.persist_private_ip is set to true.
Usage:

persist_root_device   = false
  persist_block_devices = false
  persist_private_ip    = true
  block_devices_mode    = "onLaunch"
  private_ips           = ["1.1.1.1", "2.2.2.2"]

properties.name: stateful-deallocation
properties.description: » Stateful Deallocation

properties.name: list description
should_delete_images
properties.description: (Optional) For stateful groups: remove persistent images.

properties.name: should_delete_network_interfaces
properties.description: (Optional) For stateful groups: remove network interfaces.

properties.name: should_delete_volumes
properties.description: (Optional) For stateful groups: remove persistent volumes.

properties.name: should_delete_snapshots
properties.description: (Optional) For stateful groups: remove snapshots.
Usage:

stateful_deallocation {
     should_delete_images              = false
     should_delete_network_interfaces  = false
     should_delete_volumes             = false
     should_delete_snapshots           = false
   }

properties.name: health-check
properties.description: » Health Check

properties.name: health_check_type
properties.description: (Optional) The service that will perform health checks for the instance. Supported values : "ELB", "HCS", "TARGET_GROUP", "CUSTOM", "K8S_NODE", "MLB", "EC2", "MULTAI_TARGET_SET", "MLB_RUNTIME", "K8S_NODE", "NOMAD_NODE", "ECS_CLUSTER_INSTANCE".

properties.name: health_check_grace_period
properties.description: (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, after the instance has launched to starts and check its health

properties.name: health_check_unhealthy_duration_before_replacement
properties.description: (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, that we will wait before replacing an instance that is running and became unhealthy (this is only applicable for instances that were once healthy)
Usage:

health_check_type                                  = "ELB" 
  health_check_grace_period                          = 100
  health_check_unhealthy_duration_before_replacement = 120

properties.name: third-party-integrations
properties.description: » Third-Party Integrations

properties.name: list description
properties.description: integration_rancher - (Optional) Describes the Rancher integration.

properties.name: master_host
properties.description: (Required) The URL of the Rancher Master host.

properties.name: access_key
properties.description: (Required) The access key of the Rancher API.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: (Required) The secret key of the Rancher API.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Optional) The Rancher version. Must be "1" or "2". If this field is omitted, it’s assumed that the Rancher cluster is version 1. Note that Kubernetes is required when using Rancher version 2. Usage:

integration_rancher {
    master_host = "master_host"
    access_key  = "access_key"
    secret_key  = "secret_key"
    version     = "2"
  }

properties.name: list description
properties.description: integration_ecs - (Optional) Describes the EC2 Container Service integration.

properties.name: cluster_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the EC2 Container Service cluster.

properties.name: autoscale_is_enabled
properties.description: (Optional, Default: false) Specifies whether the auto scaling feature is enabled.

properties.name: autoscale_cooldown
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 300) The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start.

properties.name: autoscale_is_auto_config
properties.description: (Optional, Default: false) Enabling the automatic auto-scaler functionality. For more information please see: ECS auto scaler.

properties.name: autoscale_scale_down_non_service_tasks
properties.description: (Optional) Determines whether to scale down non-service tasks.

properties.name: autoscale_headroom
properties.description:
(Optional) Headroom for the cluster.
  • cpu_per_unit

properties.name: cpu_per_unit
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 0) Cpu units for compute.

properties.name: memory_per_unit
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 0) RAM units for compute.

properties.name: num_of_units
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 0) Amount of units for compute.

properties.name: autoscale_down
properties.description:
(Optional) Enabling scale down.
  • evaluation_periods

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 5) Amount of cooldown evaluation periods for scale down.

properties.name: max_scale_down_percentage
properties.description: (Optional) Represents the maximum percent to scale-down. Number between 1-100.

properties.name: autoscale_attributes
properties.description: (Optional) A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

properties.name: cpu_per_unit
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 0) Cpu units for compute.

properties.name: memory_per_unit
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 0) RAM units for compute.

properties.name: num_of_units
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 0) Amount of units for compute.

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 5) Amount of cooldown evaluation periods for scale down.

properties.name: max_scale_down_percentage
properties.description: (Optional) Represents the maximum percent to scale-down. Number between 1-100.
Usage:

integration_ecs { 
    cluster_name         = "ecs-cluster"
    autoscale_is_enabled = false
    autoscale_cooldown   = 300
    autoscale_scale_down_non_service_tasks = false

    autoscale_headroom {
      cpu_per_unit    = 1024

properties.description: (Required) This will apply resuming action for Stateful instances in the Elastigroup upon scale up or capacity changes. Example usage will be for Elastigroups that will have scheduling rules to set a target capacity of 0 instances in the night and automatically restore the same state of the instances in the morning.

properties.description: (Optional) Sets the grace period for new instances to become healthy.

properties.description: (Optional) For use with should_roll. Sets minimum % of roll required to complete before continuing the plan. Required if wait_for_roll_timeout is set.

properties.name: wait_for_roll_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) For use with should_roll. Sets how long to wait for the deployed % of a roll to exceed wait_for_roll_percentage before continuing the plan. Required if wait_for_roll_percentage is set.

    type          = "MULTAI_TARGET_SET"
    balancer_id   = "lb-1ee2e3q"
    target_set_id = "ts-3eq"

  }

properties.name: image
properties.description: » Image

properties.name: image
properties.description: (Required) Image of a VM. An image is a template for creating new VMs. Choose from Azure image catalogue (marketplace) or use a custom image.

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: (Optional) Image publisher. Required if resource_group_name is not specified.

properties.name: offer
properties.description: (Optional) Name of the image to use. Required if publisher is specified.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: (Optional) Image's Stock Keeping Unit, which is the specific version of the image. Required if publisher is specified.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of Resource Group for custom image. Required if publisher not specified.

properties.name: image_name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of the custom image. Required if resource_group_name is specified.

// market image
  image {
    marketplace {
      publisher = "Canonical"
      offer     = "UbuntuServer"
      sku       = "16.04-LTS"
    }
  }

  // custom image
  image {
    custom {
      image_name          = "customImage"
      resource_group_name = "resourceGroup"
    }
  }

properties.name: auto_healing
properties.description: (Optional) Enable auto-healing of unhealthy VMs.

health_check {
    health_check_type = "INSTANCE_STATE"
    grace_period      = 120
    auto_healing      = true
  }

properties.name: network
properties.description: » Network

properties.name: network
properties.description: (Required) Defines the Virtual Network and Subnet for your Elastigroup.

properties.name: virtual_network_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of Vnet.

properties.name: subnet_name
properties.description: (Required) ID of subnet.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Required) Vnet Resource Group Name.

properties.name: assign_public_up
properties.description: (Optional, Default: false) Assign a public IP to each VM in the Elastigroup.

properties.name: additional_ip_configs
properties.description: (Optional) Array of additional IP configuration objects.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The IP configuration name.

properties.name: private_ip_version
properties.description: (Optional) Available from Azure Api-Version 2017-03-30 onwards, it represents whether the specific ipconfiguration is IPv4 or IPv6. Valid values: IPv4, IPv6.

network {
    virtual_network_name = "vname"
    subnet_name          = "my-subnet-name"
    resource_group_name  = "subnetResourceGroup"
    assign_public_ip     = true

    additional_ip_configs {
      name = "test"
      private_ip_version = "IPv4"
    }
  }

properties.name: login
properties.description: » Login

network {
    virtual_network_name = "vname"
    subnet_name          = "my-subnet-name"
    resource_group_name  = "subnetResourceGroup"
    assign_public_ip     = true
  }

properties.name: login-1

properties.name: login

properties.description: (Required) Set admin access for accessing your VMs.

properties.name: ssh_public_key
properties.description: (Optional) SSH for admin access to Linux VMs. Required for Linux product types.

properties.description: (Optional) Password for admin access to Windows VMs. Required for Windows product types.

login {
    user_name      = "admin"
    ssh_public_key = "33a2s1f3g5a1df5g1ad21651sag56dfg=="
  }

properties.name: scaling-policies
properties.description: » Scaling Policies
Each scaling_*_policy supports the following:

properties.name: policy_name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the policy.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: (Required) Metric to monitor by Azure metric display name.

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: (Optional, Default: “Microsoft.Compute”) The namespace for the alarm's associated metric. Valid values:

Microsoft.AnalysisServices/servers

  Microsoft.DataFactory/factories 
  Microsoft.DataLakeAnalytics/accounts 
  Microsoft.DataLakeStore/accounts 
  Microsoft.DBforMariaDB/servers 
  Microsoft.DBforMySQL/servers 
  Microsoft.DBforPostgreSQL/servers

properties.name: statistic
properties.description: (Optional) The metric statistics to return. Valid values: average.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Required) The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: (Required) The unit for the alarm's associated metric. Valid values: "percent, "seconds", "microseconds", "milliseconds", "bytes", "kilobytes", "megabytes", "gigabytes", "terabytes", "bits", "kilobits", "megabits", "gigabits", "terabits", "count", "bytes/second", "kilobytes/second", "megabytes/second", "gigabytes/second", "terabytes/second", "bits/second", "kilobits/second", "megabits/second", "gigabits/second", "terabits/second", "count/second", "none".

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 300) The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling activity can start. If this parameter is not specified, the default cooldown period for the group applies.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Optional, Scale Up Default: gte, Scale Down Default: lte) The operator to use in order to determine if the scaling policy is applicable. Valid values: "gt", "gte", "lt", "lte".

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 1) The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Optional, Default: 300) The granularity, in seconds, of the returned datapoints. Period must be at least 60 seconds and must be a multiple of 60.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: dimensions - (Optional) A list of dimensions describing qualities of the metric. Required when namespace is defined AND not "Microsoft.Compute".

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The dimension name.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) The dimension value.
When namespace is defined and is not "Microsoft.Compute" the list of dimensions must contain the following:

dimensions {
      name  = "resourceName"
      value = "example-resource-name"
  }
  dimensions {
      name  = "resourceGroupName"
      value = "example-resource-group-name"
  }

properties.name: action_type
properties.description: (Optional; if not using min_target_capacity or max_target_capacity) The type of action to perform for scaling. Valid values: "adjustment", "percentageAdjustment", "setMaxTarget", "setMinTarget", "updateCapacity".
If you do not specify an action type, you can only use – adjustment, min_target_capacity, max_target_capacity. While using action_type, please also set the following:

When using adjustment – set the field adjustment When using percentageAdjustment - set the field adjustment When using setMaxTarget – set the field max_target_capacity When using setMinTarget – set the field min_target_capacity When using updateCapacity – set the fields minimum, maximum, and target

properties.name: adjustment
properties.description: (Optional) Value to which the action type will be adjusted. Required if using numeric or percentage_adjustment action types.

properties.name: min_target_capacity
properties.description: (Optional; if not using adjustment; available only for scale up). The number of the desired target (and minimum) capacity

properties.name: max_target_capacity
properties.description: • max_target_capacity - (Optional; if not using adjustment; available only for scale down). The number of the desired target (and maximum) capacity

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: • minimum - (Optional; if using updateCapacity) The minimal number of instances to have in the group.

properties.name: maximum
properties.description: • maximum - (Optional; if using updateCapacity) The maximal number of instances to have in the group.

properties.name: target
properties.description: • target - (Optional; if using updateCapacity) The target number of instances to have in the group.
Usage:

// --- SCALE DOWN POLICY ------------------
  scaling_down_policy {
    policy_name = "policy-name"
    metric_name = "CPUUtilization"
    namespace   = "Microsoft.Compute"
    statistic   = "average"
    threshold   = 10
    unit        = "percent"
    cooldown    = 60

    dimensions {
      name  = "name-1"
      value = "value-1"
    }

    operator           = "gt"
    evaluation_periods = "10"
    period             = "60"

    // === MIN TARGET ===================
    # action_type         = "setMinTarget"
    # min_target_capacity = 1
    // ==================================

    // === ADJUSTMENT ===================
    action_type   = "adjustment"
    # action_type = "percentageAdjustment"
    adjustment    = "MIN(5,10)"
    // ==================================

    // === UPDATE CAPACITY ==============
    # action_type = "updateCapacity"
    # minimum     = 0
    # maximum     = 10
    # target      = 5
    // ==================================

  }
// ----------------------------------------

// --- SCALE DOWN POLICY ------------------
  scaling_down_policy {
    policy_name = "policy-name-update"
    metric_name = "CPUUtilization"
    namespace   = "Microsoft.Compute"
    statistic   = "sum"
    threshold   = 5
    unit        = "bytes"
    cooldown    = 120

    dimensions {
        name  = "name-1-update"
        value = "value-1-update"
    }

    operator           = "lt"
    evaluation_periods = 5
    period             = 120

    //// === MIN TARGET ===================
    # action_type         = "setMinTarget"
    # min_target_capacity = 1
    //// ==================================

    // === ADJUSTMENT ===================
    # action_type = "percentageAdjustment"
    # action_type = "adjustment"
    # adjustment  = "MAX(5,10)"
    // ==================================

    // === UPDATE CAPACITY ==============
    action_type = "updateCapacity"
    minimum     = 0
    maximum     = 10
    target      = 5
    // ==================================
  }
// ----------------------------------------

properties.name: scheduling
properties.description: » Scheduling

properties.name: scheduled_task
properties.description: (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: (Optional, Default: true) Describes whether the task is enabled. When true the task should run when false it should not run.

properties.name: cron_expression
properties.description: (Required) A valid cron expression (* * * * *). The cron is running in UTC time zone and is in Unix cron format Cron Expression Validator Script.

properties.name: task_type
properties.description: (Required) The task type to run. Valid Values: backup_ami, scale, scaleUp, roll, statefulUpdateCapacity, statefulRecycle.

properties.name: scale_min_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) The min capacity of the group. Should be used when choosing ‘task_type' of ‘scale'.

properties.name: scale_max_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) The max capacity of the group. Required when ‘task_type' is ‘scale'.

properties.name: scale_target_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) The target capacity of the group. Should be used when choosing ‘task_type' of ‘scale'.

properties.name: adjustment
properties.description: (Optional) The number of instances to add/remove to/from the target capacity when scale is needed.

properties.name: adjustment_percentage
properties.description: (Optional) The percent of instances to add/remove to/from the target capacity when scale is needed.

properties.name: batch_size_percentage
properties.description: (Optional) The percentage size of each batch in the scheduled deployment roll. Required when the 'task_type' is 'roll'.

properties.name: grace_period
properties.description: (Optional) The time to allow instances to become healthy.

scheduled_task {
    is_enabled      = true
    cron_expression = "* * * * *"
    task_type       = "scale"

    scale_min_capacity = 5
    scale_max_capacity = 8
    adjustment         = 2

    adjustment_percentage = 50
    scale_target_capacity = 6
    batch_size_percentage = 33
    grace_period          = 300
  }

properties.name: update-policy
properties.description: » Update Policy

properties.name: list description
properties.description: update_policy - (Optional)

properties.name: should_roll
properties.description: (Required) Sets the enablement of the roll option.

properties.name: roll_config
properties.description:
(Required) While used, you can control whether the group should perform a deployment after an update to the configuration.
  • batch_size_percentage

properties.name: batch_size_percentage
properties.description: (Required) Sets the percentage of the instances to deploy in each batch.

properties.name: health_check_type
properties.description: (Optional) Sets the health check type to use. Valid values: "INSTANCE_STATE", "NONE".

properties.name: grace_period
properties.description: (Optional) Sets the grace period for new instances to become healthy.

properties.name: batch_size_percentage
properties.description: (Required) Sets the percentage of the instances to deploy in each batch.

properties.name: health_check_type
properties.description: (Optional) Sets the health check type to use. Valid values: "INSTANCE_STATE", "NONE".

properties.name: grace_period
properties.description: (Optional) Sets the grace period for new instances to become healthy.

update_policy {
    should_roll = false

    roll_config {
      batch_size_percentage = 33
      health_check_type     = "INSTANCE_STATE"
      grace_period          = 300
    }
  }

properties.name: third-party-integrations
properties.description: » Third-Party Integrations

properties.name: list description
cluster_identifier
properties.description: (Required) The cluster ID.
Usage:

integration_kubernetes {
    cluster_identifier = "k8s-cluster-id"
  }

properties.name: list description
deployment_id
properties.description: (Optional) The deployment id you want to get
Usage:

integration_multai_runtime {
    deployment_id = ""
  }
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The group name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The region your GCP group will be created in.

properties.name: startup_script
properties.description: (Optional) Create and run your own startup scripts on your virtual machines to perform automated tasks every time your instance boots up.

properties.name: shutdown_script
properties.description: (Optional) The Base64-encoded shutdown script that executes prior to instance termination, for more information please see: Shutdown Script

properties.name: service_account
properties.description: (Optional) The email of the service account in which the group instances will be launched.

properties.name: max_size
properties.description: (Required) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.

properties.name: min_size
properties.description: (Required) The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.

properties.name: desired_capacity
properties.description: (Required) The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.

properties.name: availability_zones
properties.description: (Required) List of availability zones for the group.

properties.name: list description
region
properties.description: (Required) The region for the group of subnets.

properties.name: subnet_names
properties.description: (Required) The names of the subnets in the region.

properties.name: instance_types_preemptible
properties.description: (Required) The preemptible VMs instance type. To maximize cost savings and market availability, select as many types as possible. Required if instance_types_ondemand is not set.

properties.name: instance_types_ondemand
properties.description: (Required) The regular VM instance type to use for mixed-type groups and when falling back to on-demand. Required if instance_types_preemptible is not set.

properties.name: list description
vCPU
properties.description: (Optional) The number of vCPUs in the custom instance type. GCP has a number of limitations on accepted vCPU values. For more information, see the GCP documentation (here.)[https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/creating-instance-with-custom-machine-type#specifications]

properties.name: memory_gib
properties.description: (Optional) The memory (in GiB) in the custom instance types. GCP has a number of limitations on accepted memory values.For more information, see the GCP documentation (here.)[https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/creating-instance-with-custom-machine-type#specifications]

properties.name: preemptible_percentage
properties.description: (Optional) Percentage of Preemptible VMs to spin up from the "desired_capacity".

properties.name: on_demand_count
properties.description: (Optional) Number of regular VMs to launch in the group. The rest will be Preemptible VMs. When this parameter is specified, the preemptible_percentage parameter is being ignored.

properties.name: fallback_to_ondemand
properties.description: (Optional) Activate fallback-to-on-demand. When provisioning an instance, if no Preemptible market is available, fallback-to-on-demand will provision an On-Demand instance to maintain the group capacity.

properties.name: draining_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) Time (seconds) the instance is allowed to run after it is detached from the group. This is to allow the instance time to drain all the current TCP connections before terminating it.

properties.name: list description
key
properties.description: (Optional) Metadata key.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) Metadata value.

properties.name: list description
key
properties.description: (Optional) Labels key.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) Labels value.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) Tags to mark created instances.

properties.name: gpu
properties.description: » GPU

properties.name: list description
type
properties.description: (Required) The type of GPU instance. Valid values: nvidia-tesla-v100, nvidia-tesla-p100, nvidia-tesla-k80.

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Required) The number of GPUs. Must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8.
Usage:

gpu = {
    count = 2
    type = "nvidia-tesla-p100"
  }

properties.name: health-check
properties.description: » Health Check

properties.name: auto_healing
properties.description: (Optional) Enable auto-replacement of unhealthy instances.

properties.name: health_check_grace_period
properties.description: (Optional) Period of time (seconds) to wait for VM to reach healthiness before monitoring for unhealthiness.

properties.name: health_check_type
properties.description: (Optional) The kind of health check to perform when monitoring for unhealthiness.

properties.name: unhealthy_duration
properties.description: (Optional) Period of time (seconds) to remain in an unhealthy status before a replacement is triggered.

auto_health               = true
  health_check_grace_period = 100
  health_check_type         = ""
  unhealthy_duration        = ""

properties.name: backend-services
properties.description: » Backend Services

properties.name: list description
service_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the backend service.

properties.name: location_type
properties.description: (Optional) Sets which location the backend services will be active. Valid values: regional, global.

properties.name: scheme
properties.description: (Optional) Use when location_type is "regional". Set the traffic for the backend service to either between the instances in the vpc or to traffic from the internet. Valid values: INTERNAL, EXTERNAL.

properties.name: named_port
properties.description:
(Optional) Describes a named port and a list of ports.
  • port_name

properties.name: port_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the port.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: (Required) A list of ports.

properties.name: port_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the port.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: (Required) A list of ports.
Usage:

backend_services_config = [
    {
      service_name = "spotinst-elb-backend-service"
      locationType = "regional"
      scheme       = "INTERNAL"
      ports = {
        port_name = "port-name"
        ports = [8000, 6000]
      }
    },
  ]

properties.name: disks
properties.description: » Disks

properties.name: list description
auto_delete
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the disk will be auto-deleted when the instance is deleted.

properties.name: boot
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates that this is a boot disk. The virtual machine will use the first partition of the disk for its root filesystem.

properties.name: device_name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a unique device name of your choice.

properties.name: interface
properties.description: (Optional, Default: SCSI) Specifies the disk interface to use for attaching this disk, which is either SCSI or NVME.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Optional, Default: READ_WRITE) The mode in which to attach this disk, either READ_WRITE or READ_ONLY.

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a valid partial or full URL to an existing Persistent Disk resource. This field is only applicable for persistent disks.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional, Default: PERSISTENT) Specifies the type of disk, either SCRATCH or PERSISTENT.

properties.name: initialize_params
properties.description:
(Optional) Specifies the parameters for a new disk that will be created alongside the new instance. Use initialization parameters to create boot disks or local SSDs attached to the new instance.
  • disk_size_gb

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies disk size in gigabytes. Must be in increments of 2.

properties.name: disk_type
properties.description: (Optional, Default" pd-standard) Specifies the disk type to use to create the instance. Valid values: pd-ssd, local-ssd.

properties.name: source_image
properties.description: (Optional) A source image used to create the disk. You can provide a private (custom) image, and Compute Engine will use the corresponding image from your project.

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies disk size in gigabytes. Must be in increments of 2.

properties.name: disk_type
properties.description: (Optional, Default" pd-standard) Specifies the disk type to use to create the instance. Valid values: pd-ssd, local-ssd.

properties.name: source_image
properties.description: (Optional) A source image used to create the disk. You can provide a private (custom) image, and Compute Engine will use the corresponding image from your project.
Usage:

disks = [
    {
      device_name = "device"
      mode        = "READ_WRITE"
      type        = "PERSISTENT"
      auto_delete = true
      boot        = true
      interface   = "SCSI"

      initialize_params = {
        disk_size_gb = 10
        disk_type    = "pd-standard"
        source_image = ""
      }
    }
  ]

properties.name: network-interfaces
properties.description: » Network Interfaces

Each of the network_interface attributes controls a portion of the GCP Instance's "Network Interfaces". It's a good idea to familiarize yourself with GCP's Network Interfaces docs to understand the implications of using these attributes.

properties.name: list description
network
properties.description: (Required) Network resource for this group.

properties.name: access_configs
properties.description:
(Optional) Array of configurations.
  • name

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of this access configuration.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Array of configurations for this interface. Currently, only ONE_TO_ONE_NAT is supported.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of this access configuration.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Array of configurations for this interface. Currently, only ONE_TO_ONE_NAT is supported.

network_interface = [{ 
    network = "default"

    access_configs = {
      name = "config1"
      type = "ONE_TO_ONE_NAT"
    }

    alias_ip_ranges = {
     subnetwork_range_name = "range-name-1"
     ip_cidr_range = "10.128.0.0/20"
    }
  }]

properties.name: scaling-policies
properties.description: » Scaling Policies

properties.name: scaling_up_policy
properties.description: (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.

properties.name: scaling_down_policy
properties.description: (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup down.
Each scaling_*_policy supports the following:

properties.name: policy_name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of scaling policy.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: (Optional) Metric to monitor. Valid values: "Percentage CPU", "Network In", "Network Out", "Disk Read Bytes", "Disk Write Bytes", "Disk Write Operations/Sec", "Disk Read Operations/Sec".

properties.name: statistic
properties.description: (Optional) Statistic by which to evaluate the selected metric. Valid values: "AVERAGE", "SAMPLE_COUNT", "SUM", "MINIMUM", "MAXIMUM", "PERCENTILE", "COUNT".

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Optional) The value at which the scaling action is triggered.

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Optional) Amount of time (seconds) for which the threshold must be met in order to trigger the scaling action.

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: (Optional) Number of consecutive periods in which the threshold must be met in order to trigger a scaling action.

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: (Optional) Time (seconds) to wait after a scaling action before resuming monitoring.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Optional) The operator used to evaluate the threshold against the current metric value. Valid values: "gt" (greater than), "get" (greater-than or equal), "lt" (less than), "lte" (less than or equal).

properties.name: list description
type
properties.description: (Optional) Type of scaling action to take when the scaling policy is triggered. Valid values: "adjustment", "setMinTarget", "updateCapacity", "percentageAdjustment"

properties.name: adjustment
properties.description: (Optional) Value to which the action type will be adjusted. Required if using "numeric" or "percentageAdjustment" action types.

properties.name: list description
name
properties.description: (Required) The dimension name.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The dimension value.
Usage:

scaling = {
      up = {
        policy_name = "scale_up_1"
        source      = "stackdriver"
        metric_name = "instance/disk/read_ops_count"
        namespace   = "compute"
        statistic   = "average"
        unit        = "percent"
        threshold   = 10000
        period      = 300
        cooldown    = 300
        operator    = "gte"

        evaluation_periods = 1

        action = {
          type       = "adjustment"
          adjustment = 1
        }

        dimensions = [
          {
            name  = "storage_type"
            value = "pd-ssd"
          }
        ]
      }
    }

properties.name: third-party-integrations
properties.description: » Third-Party Integrations

properties.name: list description
master_host
properties.description: (Required) IP or FQDN of one of your swarm managers.

properties.name: master_port
properties.description: (Required) Network port used by your swarm.
Usage:

integration_docker_swarm = {
    master_host = "10.10.10.10"
    master_port = 2376
}

properties.name: scheduled-tasks
properties.description: » Scheduled Tasks
Each scheduled_task supports the following:

properties.name: task_type
properties.description: (Required) The task type to run. Valid values: "setCapacity".

properties.name: cron_expression
properties.description: (Optional) A valid cron expression. The cron is running in UTC time zone and is in Unix cron format.

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: (Optional, Default: true) Setting the task to being enabled or disabled.

properties.name: target_capacity

integration_gke {

 }

properties.name: scaling-policies
properties.description: » Scaling Policies
Possible task group scaling policies (Wrap, Clone, and New strategies): * task_scaling_up_policy * task_scaling_down_policy
Possible core group scaling policies (Clone, New strategies): * core_scaling_up_policy * core_scaling_down_policy
Each *_scaling_*_policy supports the following:

properties.name: policy_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the policy.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the metric, with or without spaces.

properties.name: statistic
properties.description: (Required) The metric statistics to return. For information about specific statistics go to Statistics in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: (Required) The unit for the metric.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Required) The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

properties.name: adjustment
properties.description: (Optional) The number of instances to add/remove to/from the target capacity when scale is needed.

properties.name: min_target_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) Min target capacity for scale up.

properties.name: max_target_capacity
properties.description: (Optional) Max target capacity for scale down.

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: (Required) The namespace for the metric.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Required) The operator to use. Allowed values are : 'gt', 'gte', 'lt' , 'lte'.

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: (Required) The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Required) The granularity, in seconds, of the returned datapoints. Period must be at least 60 seconds and must be a multiple of 60.

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: (Required) The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling activity can start.

properties.name: dimensions
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of dimensions describing qualities of the metric.

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum to set when scale is needed.

properties.name: maximum
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum to set when scale is needed.

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Optional) The number of instances to set when scale is needed.

properties.name: action_type
properties.description: (Required) The type of action to perform. Allowed values are : 'adjustment', 'setMinTarget', 'setMaxTarget', 'updateCapacity', 'percentageAdjustment'

Route provides series of matchers that follow the syntax: Path matcher: — Path("/foo/bar") // trie-based PathRegexp(“/foo/.”) // regexp-based Method matcher: — Method(“GET”) // trie-based MethodRegexp(“POST|PUT”) // regexp based Header matcher: — Header(“Content-Type”, “application/json”) // trie-based HeaderRegexp(“Content-Type”, “application/.”) // regexp based Matchers can be combined using && operator: — Method(“POST”) && Path("/v1")

  max_size         = 2
  min_size         = 1

properties.name: whitelist
properties.description: (Optional) Instance types allowed in the Ocean cluster. Cannot be configured if blacklist is configured.

properties.name: blacklist
properties.description: (Optional) Instance types not allowed in the Ocean cluster. Cannot be configured if whitelist is configured.

whitelist = ["t1.micro", "m1.small"]
// blacklist = ["t1.micro", "m1.small"]

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) Base64-encoded MIME user data to make available to the instances.

properties.name: image_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the image used to launch the instances.

properties.name: security_groups
properties.description: (Required) One or more security group ids.

properties.description: (Optional) The key pair to attach the instances.

properties.name: iam_instance_profile
properties.description: (Optional) The instance profile iam role.

properties.name: associate_public_ip_address
properties.description: (Optional, Default: false) Configure public IP address allocation.

properties.name: root_volume_size
properties.description: (Optional) The size (in Gb) to allocate for the root volume. Minimum 20.

properties.name: monitoring
properties.description: (Optional) Enable detailed monitoring for cluster. Flag will enable Cloud Watch detailed detailed monitoring (one minute increments). Note: there are additional hourly costs for this service based on the region used.

properties.name: ebs_optimized
properties.description: • ebs_optimized - (Optional) Enable EBS optimized for cluster. Flag will enable optimized capacity for high bandwidth connectivity to the EB service for non EBS optimized instance types. For instances that are EBS optimized this flag will be ignored.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: load_balancers - (Optional) - Array of load balancer objects to add to ocean cluster

properties.name: arn
properties.description: (Optional) Required if type is set to TARGET_GROUP

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) Required if type is set to CLASSIC

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Can be set to CLASSIC or TARGET_GROUP

image_id             = "ami-79826301"
  security_groups      = ["sg-042d658b3ee907848"]
  key_name             = "fake key"
  user_data            = "echo hello world"
  iam_instance_profile = "iam-profile"
  root_volume_size     = 20
  monitoring           = true
  ebs_optimized        = true

  associate_public_ip_address = true

  load_balancers {
    arn = "arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:us-west-2:fake-arn"
    type = "TARGET_GROUP"
  }

  load_balancers {
    name = "balancer-name"
    type = "CLASSIC"
  }

properties.name: fallback_to_ondemand
properties.description: (Optional, Default: true) If not Spot instance markets are available, enable Ocean to launch On-Demand instances instead.

properties.name: spot_percentage
properties.description: (Optional, Default: 100) The percentage of Spot instances the cluster should maintain. Min 0, max 100.

properties.name: utilize_reserved_instances
properties.description: (Optional, Default false) If Reserved instances exist, OCean will utilize them before launching Spot instances.

properties.name: draining_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) The time in seconds, the instance is allowed to run while detached from the ELB. This is to allow the instance time to be drained from incoming TCP connections before terminating it, during a scale down operation.

fallback_to_ondemand       = true
  spot_percentage            = 100
  utilize_reserved_instances = false
  draining_timeout           = 120

properties.name: autoscaler
properties.description: (Optional) Describes the Ocean Kubernetes autoscaler.

properties.name: autoscale_is_enabled
properties.description: (Optional, Default: true) Enable the Ocean Kubernetes autoscaler.

properties.name: autoscale_is_auto_config
properties.description: (Optional, Default: true) Automatically configure and optimize headroom resources.

properties.name: autoscale_cooldown
properties.description: (Optional, Default: null) Cooldown period between scaling actions.

properties.name: autoscale_headroom
properties.description: (Optional) Spare resource capacity management enabling fast assignment of Pods without waiting for new resources to launch.

properties.name: cpu_per_unit
properties.description: (Optional) Optionally configure the number of CPUs to allocate the headroom. CPUs are denoted in millicores, where 1000 millicores = 1 vCPU.

properties.name: gpu_per_unit
properties.description: (Optional) Optionally configure the number of GPUS to allocate the headroom.

properties.name: memory_per_unit
properties.description: (Optional) Optionally configure the amount of memory (MB) to allocate the headroom.

properties.name: num_of_units
properties.description: (Optional) The number of units to retain as headroom, where each unit has the defined headroom CPU and memory.

properties.name: autoscale_down
properties.description: (Optional) Auto Scaling scale down operations.

properties.name: evaluation_periods
properties.description: (Optional, Default: null) The number of evaluation periods that should accumulate before a scale down action takes place.

properties.name: resource_limits
properties.description: (Optional) Optionally set upper and lower bounds on the resource usage of the cluster.

properties.name: max_vcpu
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum cpu in vCPU units that can be allocated to the cluster.

properties.name: max_memory_gib
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum memory in GiB units that can be allocated to the cluster.

autoscaler {
    autoscale_is_enabled     = false
    autoscale_is_auto_config = false
    autoscale_cooldown       = 300

    autoscale_headroom {
      cpu_per_unit    = 1024
      gpu_per_unit    = 1
      memory_per_unit = 512
      num_of_units    = 2
    }

    autoscale_down {
      evaluation_periods = 300
    }

    resource_limits {
      max_vcpu       = 1024
      max_memory_gib = 20
    }
  }
